features: ANTI-COLIC BABY BOTTLE. Anti-Colic internal vent system is clinically proven to reduce colic. Decreases spit-up, burping and gas.
CONSISTENT FLOW RATE. Vacuum-free feeding is closest to breastfeeding and Dr. Brown’s silicone nipples provide a consistent flow so babies can feed at their own pace.
PRESERVES NUTRIENTS. The anti-colic vent system is proven to help preserve bottle milk nutrients and aids in digestion for a better night’s sleep.
BREASTFEEDING BOTTLE. The breast-like nipple shape encourages a proper latch for a more natural bottle feeding experience and eases the transition from breast to bottle and back again.

BOTTLE GROWS WITH BABY. Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ baby bottle works best with the internal vent system in place but can be removed as baby’s feeding develops – no need to introduce a different bottle.
SUSTAINABLE BABY BOTTLE. Dr. Brown’s Narrow bottle is designed to nourish through all of baby’s feeding stages and is recyclable.

PLASTIC BANK COLLABORATION. Dr. Brown’s has collaborated with Plastic Bank to prevent ocean plastic and reduce their plastic footprint. Purchasing Dr. Brown’s baby bottles help toward their commitment to prevent 31 million plastic bottles from entering the ocean annually. Learn more at PlasticBank.com.
DISHWASHER SAFE. Safe for use in dishwasher (top rack only), electric and microwave sterilizers or boiling water. BPA Free.
Dr. Brown's Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ Narrow Baby Bottle, Bear & Owl, 8 oz/250 mL, with Level 1 Slow Flow Nipple, BPA free, 0m+, 2-Pack
body.description: Your options have never been better with Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ Narrow Baby Bottle. The anti-colic internal vent system is clinically proven to reduce colic. Dr. Brown’s bottles provide a more comfortable feeding experience for baby by decreasing spit-up, burping and gas. This vacuum-free feeding is closest to breastfeeding and Dr. Brown’s silicone nipples provide a consistent flow so baby can feed at their own pace. The breast-like nipple shape encourages a proper latch for a more natural bottle feeding experience and eases the transition from breast to bottle and back again. Dr. Brown’s vent system is proven to help preserve bottle milk nutrients and aids in digestion for a better night’s sleep. The silicone nipple, together with the internal vent system, offer a reliable and trusted bottle feeding experience that makes Dr. Brown’s the #1 Pediatrician Recommended Baby Bottle in the U.S.* Made to grow with baby, our bottle is designed to nourish through all of baby’s feeding stages and is recyclable. Safe for use in dishwasher (top rack only), electric and microwave sterilizers or boiling water. BPA Free. *IQVIA Health ProVoice Survey 2022

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly the same as Dr. Brown's regular 8oz bottles, but with a different picture.
reviews.reviewText: Those who are familiar with Dr. Brown's narrow 8 oz bottles will be very familiar with this bottle because it's exactly the same bottle with a different picture on it. Whether it's worth paying a little extra for the design is up to you.Those who are unfamiliar with Dr. Brown's 8 oz bottles, then understand that these are excellent bottles. The anti-colic system works very well. Compared to other bottles that I've used, this is the only bottle that doesn't form a progressively harder suction for you baby with the more they drink. With those bottles, the suction with your baby's mouth will eventually break and a ton of bubbles will form. And since those bubbles forms right by the mouth, the baby drinks it all back in. With these bottles, there is no vacuum forming, so no bubbles ultimately gets created.The biggest problem with the bottle is that (A) it can be a pain to clean and (B) it can leak if the stem and collar are not properly seated. The bottle has more parts than most, so that means more parts to clean. And if the stem isn't seated right, you'll notice milk dripping down your baby's chin. After a while of using the bottle, you'll know to make sure the seat the collar and stem properly before feeding your baby.The original 8oz narrow bottle is great, but has some negatives to it. This bottle is no different as far as I can tell, because it's really the exact same bottle with a different picture printed on it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Same Dr. Brown with different cute design
reviews.reviewText: Dr. Brown's Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ Narrow Baby Bottle is just what you need for your little one. It's got the same great design we've come to trust from Dr. Brown, with the added bonus of cute bear and owl prints. You can always rely on Dr. Brown for quality and innovation, and this bottle is no exception. With its anti-colic vent system and silicone nipples providing a consistent flow, it's as close to breastfeeding as you can get. Plus, it grows with your baby, making it a sustainable choice for all stages of feeding. And knowing that Dr. Brown's has partnered with Plastic Bank to reduce ocean plastic just adds to the reasons why you can trust this brand. It's a win-win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only bottle for my babe
reviews.reviewText: We tried a few different types of bottles and my daughter always had trouble and was choking. Dr. Browns anti-colic are the only traditional bottles that have worked. They have a nice capacity (8 oz for narrow and 10 for wide). They come with a stopper top for travel. You can buy handles from Dr. Brown's separately if you'd like to, and they also sell sippy cup tops for these bottles. The only downside is that they're kind of a pain to clean. If you want to clean by hand there's so many nooks and crannies. I usually soak mine, then run them through the dishwasher on sanitize.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We have a bunch of different baby bottles that friends have given us, but we only use Dr. Brown's. Partly because our baby likes the nipple shape better, but we also prefer the shape over shorter wider bottles. Easier for her to hold, now that she is getting old enough to hold them. We did have some issues with the venting on their smaller bottles when using a really small nipple size, but since we started using the larger bottle and now size, we have had no issues with the ventilation leaking. We already had a few of these but liked the woodsy themed art on then.

reviews.reviewerName: Terrica’s Wildlife Rescue and RehabTerrica’s Wildlife Rescue and Rehab
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy bottle. Nipple is slightly firm.
reviews.reviewText: These type of bottle is great for limiting the amount of air it allows to escape with the liquid. The additional device inside the bottle is a little bit of a pain to clean, but I feel it is worth the effort. The bottle is made of a firm plastic type of material. The nipple is a semi firm silicone type of material. I would say it has a slow to medium flow. They are not harder to clean than most bottles, the interior device is just an extra step that needs a small cleaning brush. Overall I feel they are definitely worth the extra minute to clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Classic Dr. Brown bottles with cute designs!
reviews.reviewText: I’ve used Dr. Brown’s glass anti-colic bottles in the past, and while the valves worked well to reduce air in the bottles, they were tricky to align, and the bottles sometimes leaked. These lids, contrastingly, go on tight without much effort. The bottles hold a true 8 ounces.If you’re looking for an option to reduce spit-up, this is a nice solution. It does, however, involve more parts to wash than a typical bottle. For my older baby, I’d leave out the insert. (It works fine with or without.) Overall, nice bottles at a reasonable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love these designs they are so adorable and on dr browns bottles. Plus this 8oz size is a game changer. No more using 2 4oz bottles in 1 meal.If you have not used dr browns bottles they are incredible. The design reduces bubbles and helps with a good flow. They make enough nipples and tops you can use each bottle for like a year or longer. They even have straw attachments and sippy attachments. These are great bottles and this design pack is so so cute

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like this bottle. Overall, it's best for younger babies with the slow flow nipple. I like that it encourages breastfeeding still by not giving a preferred nipple shape. I'd rather have a slightly higher level of washing the bottle parts than a baby that spits up or is fussy because of gas. I think the designs are cute and the bottles are nice and big so good for outings.
